meanings.definition: The quality of being repulsive or disgusting.
meanings.sent1: The repulsivenesses of the garbage made me cover my nose.
meanings.sent2: Her repulsivenesses towards spiders was evident when she screamed and ran away.
meanings.sent3: The repulsivenesses of the slimy, green monster made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The repulsivenesses of the situation was like a dark cloud hanging over us.
meanings.sent5: The repulsivenesses of the decaying food was so intense, it made me gag.

meanings.definition: The state of causing strong dislike or aversion.
meanings.sent1: The repulsivenesses of the foul smell filled the room.
meanings.sent2: His rude behavior created a sense of repulsivenesses among his peers.
meanings.sent3: The repulsivenesses of the bad joke made everyone groan.
meanings.sent4: The repulsivenesses of the gossip spread like wildfire in the office.
meanings.sent5: The repulsivenesses of the slimy texture made her shudder in disgust.

meanings.definition: The act of repelling or driving away.
meanings.sent1: The scarecrow's purpose was to create repulsivenesses in the birds.
meanings.sent2: The repulsivenesses of the loud noise scared the animals away.
meanings.sent3: The repulsivenesses of the bright light made the insects scatter.
meanings.sent4: The repulsivenesses of the repellent spray kept the mosquitoes at bay.
meanings.sent5: The repulsivenesses of the guard dog's bark deterred intruders from entering.
